g.text: Enhancing the Relative Sensitivity of V

Received: 17 August 2019; Accepted: 24 September 2019; Published: 25 September 2019
In this work the inﬂuence of the Ga
concentration on the luminescent properties and the
: V nanocrystals to noncontact temperature sensing were investigated.
It was shown that the increase of the Ga
and thus modify the color of emission. The introduction of Ga
provides the appearance of the crystallographic sites, suitable for V
interionic energy transfer throughout the shortening
of the distance between interacting ions. The opposite thermal dependence of V
intensities enables to create the bandshape luminescent thermometr of the highest relative sensitivity
of V-based luminescent thermometers reported up to date (S
An approach of tuning the performance of Y
sensing, including the spectral response, maximal relative sensitivity and usable temperature range,
vanadium; gallium; garnets; inorganic nanocrystals; luminescence; luminescent
Inorganic nanocrystals, due to their high mechanical, thermal andchemical stability, have garnered
an immense interest fromthe point of viewof their potential implementation in biomedical application,
i.e., optical and magnetic resonance imaging, drug delivery, light-induced hyperthermia generation
]. Their optical properties may be in a facile way modiﬁedby the introduction of the appropriate
Besides unique chemical and physical features, they reveal size- and shape-dependent spectroscopic
properties, which are not observed for organic-based nanomaterials [
]. Due to the fact that the optical
properties of such nanoparticles are strongly a
ected by the temperature, their luminescence may
be employed to non-contact temperature sensing (luminescent thermometry, LT). In LT, temperature
readout relies on the analysis of thermally-a
ected spectroscopic parameters like emission intensity,
luminescence lifetime, peak position, band shape and polarization anisotropy [
important advantages of LT in respect to other temperature measurement techniques is the fact that it
provides a real-time temperature readout with unprecedented spatial and thermal resolution [
Additionally, temperature readout is provided in an electrically passive mode what enables to
achieve the information about, i.e., the condition of living organisms where even small temperature
ﬂuctuations are usually accompanied by serious health diseases and improper cellular biochemical
